meanings.definition: Pressruns: the total number of copies printed in a single printing session
meanings.sent1: The pressruns for the new book reached a thousand copies.
meanings.sent2: The pressruns of the newspaper were completed early in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The pressruns of the magazine were so many that the printer ran out of paper!
meanings.sent4: The pressruns of the brochure flowed out of the printing press like a river of words.
meanings.sent5: The pressruns of the flyer were so impressive that everyone wanted a copy.

meanings.definition: Pressruns: to print copies of a publication using a printing press
meanings.sent1: They pressruns the flyers for the event every week.
meanings.sent2: She pressruns the posters for the school play with great care.
meanings.sent3: I pressruns the invitations so fast that the ink splattered everywhere!
meanings.sent4: The printing press pressruns the newspapers like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: He pressruns the brochures with precision to ensure quality copies.

meanings.definition: Pressruns: a series of consecutive printings of a publication
meanings.sent1: The pressruns of the magazine were done in batches.
meanings.sent2: The pressruns of the catalog were completed ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent3: The pressruns of the newsletter seemed never-ending!
meanings.sent4: The pressruns of the leaflet were like a chain of printing sessions.
meanings.sent5: The pressruns of the brochure were organized into multiple rounds for efficiency.
